page.title: 10Conservation at Ryton
page.content: The establishing of this conservation area came about following the conclusion of gravel excavation and landfill.The site is monitored by the Warks Nature Conservation Trust. Ryton Pool is located south east of Bubbenhall village.The pool is a disused gravel pit transformed into a nature reserve.The pool attracts many types of wildlife.Many breeds of water birds inhabit the centre island in the pool including Canada geese,coots and two types of duck.Sand martins make their nests in the banks as the sand from the excavations is still there .A number of butterflies and insects also live on the nature reserve including the Common blue butterfly and the small copper.Dragonflies can sometimes be seen in the summer.To fish in Ryton pool is prohibited unless you have a permit.
